poem:
### The Maze of Governance

In the Westminster whirligig, puzzlement reigns,  
Paths crisscross like spiders' silk in morning dew,  
Davey demands truth where shadows hold sway,  
Gill's undone by secrets, stitched into the court's refrain,  
While Reeves stands on crossroads, no compass to guide,  
Amidst whispers of Moscow's breath in the British breeze.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Reeves ‘not even sure what the popular path is’ on the budget – UK politics live 2.59pm GMT Ed Davey calls for an investigation into Russian interference in UK politics Liberal Democrats leader Ed Davey has demanded an investigation into Russian interference in UK politics, reports the PA news agency. Davey’s comments come as Reform UK’s former leader in Wales, Nathan Gill, was jailed at the Old Bailey on Friday for 10 and a half". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
